did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Jack E. Reynolds Papers, 1950-1992
did.abstract: Contains letters from customers and colleagues, writers, and artists; major correspondents are J. Frank Dobie, Helen S. Giffen, Carl Hertzog, Lawrence Clark Powell, Ralph W. Yarborough, and David Magee. Also present is material by and about Reynolds, Dobie, Hertzog, Powell, Yarborough, and Magee; as well as about Ross Santee.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Jack E. Reynolds papers(MS 147). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jack E. Reynolds was a bookseller, specializing in Western Americana; his store was located in Van Nuys, California.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains letters from customers and colleagues, writers, and artists; major correspondents are J. Frank Dobie, Helen S. Giffen, Carl Hertzog, Lawrence Clark Powell, Ralph W. Yarborough, and David Magee. Also present is material by and about Reynolds, Dobie, Hertzog, Powell, Yarborough, and Magee; as well as about Ross Santee. An original Santee watercolor is included in his file. Proof copies are present of Magee's book Infinite Riches, and Powell's book A Southwestern Century, published by Reynolds in 1958. With the Powell materials are two engraving plates used for its cover illustration, by Tom Lea. The special "occasional" catalogs produced by Reynolds include original essays by select authors, and are accompanied by letters commenting on the issues. Photographs depict the first and second bookstores, Reynolds, Powell, Dobie, and Santee.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Books received with this collection have been removed and catalogued separately. An inventory of these books is available at the repository.

Adams, Ramon. 1954-1956
Cisneros, Jose. 1968-1969
De Yong, Joe. 1958-1969
Dobie, J. Frank. 1953-1964

Correspondence from others regarding J. Frank Dobie. 1956-1972
Dawson, Glen. 1970-1990
Hertzog, Carl. 1957-1984
Hutchinson, William Henry. 1960-1977
Lea, Tom. (Testimonial Dinner, El Paso). September, 1957
Powell, Lawrence Clark. 1954-1984
Winterich, John Tracy. 1954-1976
Yarborough, Ralph Webster. 1963-1977

scopecontent.p: Also copy of Potomac Corral Dust (Spring 1967) with excerpts of Yarborough talk, and copy of talk: "J. Frank Dobie, Man and Friend."

Collectors, Dealers, Librarians, etc. 1953-1991
Western Artists (various). 1950-1968
Southwest Conference (suggested revival of). 1960
University of Oklahoma Press. 1954, 1972

scopecontent.p: Correspondence relating to Press objections to quotations from Six Guns and Saddle Leather in Reynolds Catalog #21.

did.unittitle: Series II: Catalogs, 1958-1975
Catalog #50, with essay by J. Frank Dobie.
Catalog #56, on Custer, with introduction by James Hutchins.
Catalog #58, on Charles P. Everitt, with introduction by J. Frank Dobie, and manuscript partly in Dobie's hand.
Catalog #61, on Eugene Manlove Rhodes, with essays by W. H. Hutchinson and W. C. Tuttle.
Catalog #80, on Robert G. Cowan, with Cowan introduction.
Catalog #81, on Pete Martinez, with original etching and photos.
Catalog #84, on Dorothy Stauffer Hay, with manuscripts of introductions, photographs, and prints of Hay's work.
Catalog #90, on The West, with manuscript of introductory essay by Ralph Yarborough, and correspondence.
Catalog #99, on J. Frank Dobie, with letters from Bertha Dobie.
Catalog #129, on Will Rogers. Includes letters from Will Rogers, Jr.
Catalog #140, on American Indians. Correspondence with David H. Miller.
Catalog #141, on Ward Ritchie and Southern California Printers.
Series III: David Magee Materials, 1958-1976
Correspondence. 1958-1976
Infinite Riches (Typescript).
Infinite Riches (Page proofs).
The Golden Cave (Typescript, final version with corrections).
A Flag for Christmas and Indian Corn: A Thanksgiving Extravaganza.
Interview with David Magee, San Francisco. April 8, 1969

scopecontent.p: Transcript of tape made by Ruth Teiser.

did.unittitle: First catalog compiled by David Magee (2 copies).
Grabhorn Press Items (miscellaneous, signed by David Magee).
"Life and Death of Athena, an Owlet from the Parthenon." (Page proofs, holograph and typed manuscripts of Magee's introduction).
Series IV: Miscellaneous Materials, 1953-1965
Reynolds, Jack (articles by and about).
Photographs (J. Frank Dobie, Jack Reynolds, Reynolds' shops).
Hertzog, Carl: Miscellaneous publications and ephemera.
Powell, Lawrence Clark: "Christmas...The Southwest...and J. Frank Dobie." (Typescript, page proofs, correspondence, etc.).
Powell, Lawrence Clark: A Southwestern Century. (Dummy, dust wrapper, announcement, correspondence, etc.).
Powell, Lawrence Clark: Miscellaneous articles. (Typescripts, reprints. Inscribed).
Two original plates of Tom Lea illustrations for A Southwestern Century.
